title: Cristian Panin
text:
Cristian Călin Panin (born 9 June 1978) is a retired <a href="Romania">Romania</a>n footballer who played as a <a href="right%20back">right back</a> or <a href="left%20back">left back</a>. He is currently the team manager at <a href="CFR%20Cluj">CFR Cluj</a>.
Club career.
UTA Arad.
Panin began his career at <a href="UTA%20Arad">UTA Arad</a>, spending seven seasons at the senior squad of The Old Lady, six in the <a href="Liga%20II">second league</a> and one in the <a href="Liga%20I">first league</a>.
CFR Cluj.
During the summer of 2004 he moved to <a href="CFR%20Cluj">CFR Cluj</a>. Panin played 9 games in the <a href="2005%20UEFA%20Intertoto%20Cup">2005 Intertoto Cup</a> when the team reached the final. He spent 9 seasons wearing the Feroviarii's shirt and although numerous players, including Swedish international <a href="Mikael%20Dorsin">Mikael Dorsin</a>, have attempted to replace him, he still remained a key player in CFR Cluj's first team. Panin helped <a href="CFR%20Cluj">CFR Cluj</a> win three <a href="Liga%20I">Liga I</a> titles, three <a href="Cupa%20Rom%C3%A2niei">Cupa României</a>, two <a href="Supercupa%20Rom%C3%A2niei">Supercupa României</a>, as well as appearing in 9 <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">Champions League</a> matches and in 10 <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">Europa League</a> matches.
International career.
Cristian Panin played two games for <a href="Romania%20national%20football%20team">Romania</a>, making his debut on 19 November 2008 when coach <a href="Victor%20Pi%C8%9Burc%C4%83">Victor Pițurcă</a> introduced him in the 25th minute to replace <a href="George%20Og%C4%83raru">George Ogăraru</a> in a friendly against <a href="Georgia%20national%20football%20team">Georgia</a> which ended with a 2–1 victory. His second game was a 3–1 victory against <a href="Faroe%20islands%20national%20football%20team">Faroe Islands</a> at the <a href="2010%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%E2%80%93%20UEFA%20Group%207">2010 World Cup qualifiers</a>.
After retiring.
After retiring in 2013, Panin joined the technical staff of <a href="CFR%20Cluj">CFR Cluj</a> as a team manager. Panin had performed several club functions during his time in staff of the club.
Honours.
UTA Arad
CFR Cluj
